text:
Hi 
MS announced that Classic Teams users will be updated to new Teams after March
2024, but looks like MS are pushing early as some of our users had the "forced"
screen recently and looking at other forums a few others have been forced over
too over the last month. Some of our users (including myself) who have had the
update have seen a number of bugs in the new version Teams. We have had to
switch back to classic due to crashing issues and the concern is this may become
a wider issue to our end-user community as Teams is not managed as part of the
M365 update but rather "MS controlled" through Teams Admin with limited
options. 
I'm wondering if anyone else has seen this issue and how have you addressed it
within your org? Did you send any comms to end-users to notify them of the new
update and the option to switch back to classic if they experience any issues? 
Not even sure why MS couldn't allow IT admins the ability to deploy Teams
updates through any delivery mechanism in the same way for M365 apps! 
Thanks,
Amag 
--
%40googlegroups.com

metadata.topic: Forcing Classic Teams users to new Teams
metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] Forcing Classic Teams users to new Teams
